titleStmt.title: W. E. Baker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6210

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of Adair County represent that James Fletcher who was at the last Novr, term of the Adair Circuit Court fined twenty dollars and costs for retailing Whiskey without license in Adair County represent that said Fletcher at the time was a minor from the best information they can obtain and that he is poor and a cripple therefore we ask your Excellency to remit said fine and as in in duty bound &c --

W. E Baker
C. J. Taylor.
Wm. H. Walker.
S. M. Baker
Jesse Murrell
John W. Butler
Wm T Smythe
W. C. Baker
Gaither Miller
W. H. Hudson
S. T. Dunbar
John Eubank
J. W. Suddarth
Alfred Gilmer
O. B. Patterson
G. W. Overstreet

Adair Cir Ct
vs
Jas Fletcher
$20,
Remitted
16th Mch/65
